> Not entirely sure what you want to check here. The only requirement to
> be a Java Bean is that it has a zero-argument constructor.

I was think in the lines of all states exposed in its properties (with
"get", "set", "is" conventions), each independent of the others and the a
no-argument constructor.

I suppose the art becomes identifying what feilds are independent states?
I'm not sure this could be generalised though.

Morten
